comments:
If an EReference in an ecore model doesn't have an eType, then the generator silently fails.  The error is available in the error log view.  But this error is not useful for figuring out the problem.

Validating the model does report an error. 

Looking at how  upperBound="*" is now handled, perhaps this error could be detected and reported when the genmodel is opened, in that same way.

Exception:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenTypedElementImpl.getTypeGenPackage(GenTypedElementImpl.java:65)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenPackageImpl$DependencyHelper.<init>(GenPackageImpl.java:1951)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenPackageImpl.prepareCache(GenPackageImpl.java:2705)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.generator.GenPackageGeneratorAdapter.doPreGenerate(GenPackageGeneratorAdapter.java:126)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.generator.AbstractGeneratorAdapter.preGenerate(AbstractGeneratorAdapter.java:147)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.generator.Generator.generate(Generator.java:296)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.presentation.GenModelActionBarContributor$8.execute(GenModelActionBarContributor.java:370)
at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Our new coop student, Wilson, is starting to work on Ecore constraint validation, i.e., https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=75933.  We expect to diagnose all the potential problems before they cause code generation to barf.  So I'll return this as a duplicate of that bugzilla.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 75933 ***
